Title: Austria wins gold at EuroSkills
Summary: DENMARK: Austrian Jonas Danninger, an employee of Hauser GmbH, won the Refrigeration and Air Conditioning gold medal at last week’s EuroSkills competition in Herning, Denmark.

Title: Carrier completes 10-14ton RTU challenge
Summary: USA: Carrier has become the first manufacturer to complete the US Department of Energy's Commercial Building HVAC Technology Challenge laboratory validation in the 10-14ton rooftop heat pump category.

Title: Danfoss sells Dutch subsidiary Sondex BV
Summary: DENMARK/NETHERLANDS: Danfoss Plate Heat Exchangers has sold its Dutch heat exchanger subsidiary, Sondex BV, to heat exchanger experts Theo Thoen and Hans Ter Velde.

Title: Former Hawco MD to head K2 Engineering
Summary: UK: Martin Butler, former managing director of Hawco, has joined Surrey-based refrigeration consultants K2 Engineering (Cooling) as MD.

Title: Langford appointed Panasonic UK country manager
Summary: UK: Mick Langford has been appointed UK country manager for Panasonic’s heating and cooling division. He replaces John Kellett who has stepped down from the role for personal reasons.

Title: Paul Singh to stand for IOR president
Summary: UK: Paul Singh, owner of the Chillair (UK) Training Academy, has joined  the race to be elected as the next president of the Institute of Refrigeration (IOR).

Title: Industry recognition for Matt Morton
Summary: UK: Matt Morton, chairman of Durham-based EJM Engineered Systems, has received the Institute of Refrigeration’s Northern Branch Lifetime Achievement Award for his outstanding contribution to the industry.

Title: Lawton Tubes opens training studio
Summary: UK: A new training studio to help inspire the next generation of air conditioning engineers, plumbers, and medical gas technicians has been announced by copper tube supplier Lawton Tubes.
